title: Bandipur National Park
description: Bandipur National Park, located in Karnataka, India, is a renowned wildlife sanctuary and part of the Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve. Spanning 868 sq km, it is home to diverse flora and fauna, including tigers, elephants, leopards, and Indian gaurs. Known for its dry deciduous forests and rich biodiversity, the park is a key tiger reserve under Project Tiger. It offers eco-tourism activities like safaris and birdwatching while maintaining strict conservation efforts.

title: Nagarhole National Park
description: Nagarhole National Park, located in Karnataka, India, is a key part of the Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve and a crucial tiger reserve under Project Tiger. Covering approximately 848 sq km, it features dense forests, rivers, and rich biodiversity, including tigers, elephants, leopards, and deer. The park is known for its scenic landscapes, abundant wildlife, and opportunities for safaris and birdwatching. It plays a vital role in conservation efforts and is a popular eco-tourism destination.

title: Dubare Elephant Camp
description: Dubare Elephant Camp, located on the banks of the Cauvery River in Karnataka, India, is a popular eco-tourism destination known for its elephant interactions. Managed by the Karnataka Forest Department, the camp offers visitors a chance to observe, bathe, and feed elephants while learning about their conservation. It also features activities like river rafting, birdwatching, and nature walks, making it a favorite spot for wildlife enthusiasts and nature lovers.
